meanings.definition: The quality or state of causing harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: The injuriousness of the sharp knife was evident when it accidentally cut through the paper.
meanings.sent2: The injuriousness of the chemicals in the cleaning solution made it unsafe for children to use.
meanings.sent3: Despite its small size, the injuriousness of the tiny cactus needles was no joke.
meanings.sent4: The injuriousness of gossip can leave emotional scars that are not easily healed.
meanings.sent5: The injuriousness of the storm was evident as it left a trail of destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: The act of causing harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: The injuriousness of the fall resulted in a broken arm for the clumsy hiker.
meanings.sent2: The injuriousness of the car accident led to a lengthy legal battle over compensation.
meanings.sent3: The injuriousness of the banana peel on the floor caused a comical slip for the unsuspecting pedestrian.
meanings.sent4: The injuriousness of the harsh words spoken in anger can leave lasting wounds.
meanings.sent5: The injuriousness of the faulty wiring caused a fire that destroyed the entire house.
